page.title: 09Birdwatching
page.content:
Sometimes my friend and I go to the woods to look for birds. The most common bird in Croxteth is a sparrow, I think. I once saw a sparrowhawk swoop down to collect a hare. I have seen wrens, blackbirds, song-thrushes, kestrels, sparrowhawks, great-tits, blue-tits, and several types of finch. I have seen a dunnock's nest with three chicks in, and a moorhen's with six eggs. I remember one night hearing a squawk, and looking up to see a magpie chick standing on the roof of the ambulance station. Almost every night I go over to the woods and watch the kestrels collecting their prey.
Stewart Stirrup
